speaker: MARIA
text: Nay, either tell me where thou hast been, or I

speaker: MARIA
text: will not open my lips so wide as a bristle may enter

speaker: MARIA
text: in way of thy excuse. My lady will hang thee for thy

speaker: MARIA
text: absence.

speaker: FOOL
text: Let her hang me. He that is well hanged in this

speaker: FOOL
text: world needs to fear no colors.

speaker: MARIA
text: Make that good.

speaker: FOOL
text: He shall see none to fear.

speaker: MARIA
text: A good Lenten answer. I can tell thee where

speaker: MARIA
text: that saying was born, of “I fear no colors.”

speaker: FOOL
text: Where, good Mistress Mary?

speaker: MARIA
text: In the wars; and that may you be bold to say in

speaker: MARIA
text: your foolery.

speaker: FOOL
text: Well, God give them wisdom that have it, and

speaker: FOOL
text: those that are Fools, let them use their talents.

speaker: MARIA
text: Yet you will be hanged for being so long absent.

speaker: MARIA
text: Or to be turned away, is not that as good as a

speaker: MARIA
text: hanging to you?

speaker: FOOL
text: Many a good hanging prevents a bad marriage,

speaker: FOOL
text: and, for turning away, let summer bear it out.

speaker: MARIA
text: You are resolute, then?

speaker: FOOL
text: Not so, neither, but I am resolved on two points.

speaker: MARIA
text: That if one break, the other will hold, or if both

speaker: MARIA
text: break, your gaskins fall.

speaker: FOOL
text: Apt, in good faith, very apt. Well, go thy way. If Sir

speaker: FOOL
text: Toby would leave drinking, thou wert as witty a

speaker: FOOL
text: piece of Eve’s flesh as any in Illyria.

speaker: MARIA
text: Peace, you rogue. No more o’ that. Here comes

speaker: MARIA
text: my lady. Make your excuse wisely, you were best.

speaker: FOOL
text: Wit, an ’t be thy will, put me into good

speaker: FOOL
text: fooling! Those wits that think they have thee do very

speaker: FOOL
text: oft prove fools, and I that am sure I lack thee may

speaker: FOOL
text: pass for a wise man. For what says Quinapalus?

speaker: FOOL
text: “Better a witty Fool than a foolish wit.”—God bless

speaker: FOOL
text: thee, lady!

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Take the Fool away.

speaker: FOOL
text: Do you not hear, fellows? Take away the Lady.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Go to, you’re a dry Fool. I’ll no more of you.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Besides, you grow dishonest.

speaker: FOOL
text: Two faults, madonna, that drink and good counsel

speaker: FOOL
text: will amend. For give the dry Fool drink, then is

speaker: FOOL
text: the Fool not dry. Bid the dishonest man mend

speaker: FOOL
text: himself; if he mend, he is no longer dishonest; if he

speaker: FOOL
text: cannot, let the botcher mend him. Anything that’s

speaker: FOOL
text: mended is but patched; virtue that transgresses is

speaker: FOOL
text: but patched with sin, and sin that amends is but

speaker: FOOL
text: patched with virtue. If that this simple syllogism

speaker: FOOL
text: will serve, so; if it will not, what remedy? As there is

speaker: FOOL
text: no true cuckold but calamity, so beauty’s a flower.

speaker: FOOL
text: The Lady bade take away the Fool. Therefore, I say

speaker: FOOL
text: again, take her away.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Sir, I bade them take away you.

speaker: FOOL
text: Misprision in the highest degree! Lady, cucullus

speaker: FOOL
text: non facit monachum. That’s as much to say as, I

speaker: FOOL
text: wear not motley in my brain. Good madonna, give

speaker: FOOL
text: me leave to prove you a fool.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Can you do it?

speaker: FOOL
text: Dexteriously, good madonna.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Make your proof.

speaker: FOOL
text: I must catechize you for it, madonna. Good my

speaker: FOOL
text: mouse of virtue, answer me.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Well, sir, for want of other idleness, I’ll bide

speaker: OLIVIA
text: your proof.

speaker: FOOL
text: Good madonna, why mourn’st thou?

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Good Fool, for my brother’s death.

speaker: FOOL
text: I think his soul is in hell, madonna.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: I know his soul is in heaven, Fool.

speaker: FOOL
text: The more fool, madonna, to mourn for your

speaker: FOOL
text: brother’s soul, being in heaven. Take away the fool,

speaker: FOOL
text: gentlemen.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: What think you of this Fool, Malvolio? Doth he

speaker: OLIVIA
text: not mend?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Yes, and shall do till the pangs of death

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: shake him. Infirmity, that decays the wise, doth

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: ever make the better Fool.

speaker: FOOL
text: God send you, sir, a speedy infirmity, for the

speaker: FOOL
text: better increasing your folly! Sir Toby will be sworn

speaker: FOOL
text: that I am no fox, but he will not pass his word for

speaker: FOOL
text: twopence that you are no fool.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: How say you to that, Malvolio?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: I marvel your Ladyship takes delight in

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: such a barren rascal. I saw him put down the other

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: day with an ordinary fool that has no more brain

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: than a stone. Look you now, he’s out of his guard

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: already. Unless you laugh and minister occasion to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: him, he is gagged. I protest I take these wise men

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: that crow so at these set kind of Fools no better than

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: the Fools’ zanies.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: O, you are sick of self-love, Malvolio, and taste

speaker: OLIVIA
text: with a distempered appetite. To be generous, guiltless,

speaker: OLIVIA
text: and of free disposition is to take those things

speaker: OLIVIA
text: for bird-bolts that you deem cannon bullets. There

speaker: OLIVIA
text: is no slander in an allowed Fool, though he do

speaker: OLIVIA
text: nothing but rail; nor no railing in a known discreet

speaker: OLIVIA
text: man, though he do nothing but reprove.

speaker: FOOL
text: Now Mercury endue thee with leasing, for thou

speaker: FOOL
text: speak’st well of Fools!

speaker: MARIA
text: Madam, there is at the gate a young gentleman

speaker: MARIA
text: much desires to speak with you.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: From the Count Orsino, is it?

speaker: MARIA
text: I know not, madam. ’Tis a fair young man, and

speaker: MARIA
text: well attended.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Who of my people hold him in delay?

speaker: MARIA
text: Sir Toby, madam, your kinsman.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Fetch him off, I pray you. He speaks nothing

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
but madman. Fie on him!
                 
                Maria
                 
                exits
                .
               Go you,

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Malvolio. If it be a suit from the Count, I am sick,

speaker: OLIVIA
text: or not at home; what you will, to dismiss it.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Now you see, sir, how your fooling

speaker: OLIVIA
text: grows old, and people dislike it.

speaker: FOOL
text: Thou hast spoke for us, madonna, as if thy eldest

speaker: FOOL
text: son should be a Fool, whose skull Jove cram with

speaker: FOOL
text: brains, for—here he comes—one of thy kin has a

speaker: FOOL
text: most weak pia mater.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: By mine honor, half drunk!—What is he at the

speaker: OLIVIA
text: gate, cousin?

speaker: TOBY
text: A gentleman.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: A gentleman? What gentleman?

speaker: TOBY
text: ’Tis a gentleman here—a plague o’ these pickle

speaker: TOBY
text: herring!—How now, sot?

speaker: FOOL
text: Good Sir Toby.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Cousin, cousin, how have you come so early by

speaker: OLIVIA
text: this lethargy?

speaker: TOBY
text: Lechery? I defy lechery. There’s one at the gate.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Ay, marry, what is he?

speaker: TOBY
text: Let him be the devil an he will, I care not. Give

speaker: TOBY
text: me faith, say I. Well, it’s all one.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: What’s a drunken man like, Fool?

speaker: FOOL
text: Like a drowned man, a fool, and a madman. One

speaker: FOOL
text: draught above heat makes him a fool, the second

speaker: FOOL
text: mads him, and a third drowns him.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Go thou and seek the crowner and let him sit o’

speaker: OLIVIA
text: my coz, for he’s in the third degree of drink: he’s

speaker: OLIVIA
text: drowned. Go look after him.

speaker: FOOL
text: He is but mad yet, madonna, and the Fool shall

speaker: FOOL
text: look to the madman.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Madam, yond young fellow swears he will

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: speak with you. I told him you were sick; he takes

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: on him to understand so much, and therefore

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: comes to speak with you. I told him you were

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: asleep; he seems to have a foreknowledge of that

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: too, and therefore comes to speak with you. What is

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: to be said to him, lady? He’s fortified against any

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: denial.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Tell him he shall not speak with me.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Has been told so, and he says he’ll stand at

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: your door like a sheriff’s post and be the supporter

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: to a bench, but he’ll speak with you.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: What kind o’ man is he?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Why, of mankind.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: What manner of man?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Of very ill manner. He’ll speak with you,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: will you or no.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Of what personage and years is he?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Not yet old enough for a man, nor young

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: enough for a boy—as a squash is before ’tis a

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: peascod, or a codling when ’tis almost an apple. ’Tis

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: with him in standing water, between boy and man.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: He is very well-favored, and he speaks very shrewishly.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: One would think his mother’s milk were

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: scarce out of him.

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
Let
               
              him
               
              approach
              .
               
              Call
               
              in
               
              my
               
              gentlewoman
              .

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Gentlewoman, my lady calls.

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
Give
               
              me
               
              my
               
              veil
              .
               
              Come
              ,
               
              throw
               
              it
               
              o’er
               
              my
               
              face
              .

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
We’ll
               
              once
               
              more
               
              hear
               
              Orsino’s
               
              embassy
              .

speaker: VIOLA
text: The honorable lady of the house, which is she?

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Speak to me. I shall answer for her. Your will?

speaker: VIOLA
text: Most radiant, exquisite, and unmatchable

speaker: VIOLA
text: beauty—I pray you, tell me if this be the lady of the

speaker: VIOLA
text: house, for I never saw her. I would be loath to cast

speaker: VIOLA
text: away my speech, for, besides that it is excellently

speaker: VIOLA
text: well penned, I have taken great pains to con it. Good

speaker: VIOLA
text: beauties, let me sustain no scorn. I am very comptible

speaker: VIOLA
text: even to the least sinister usage.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Whence came you, sir?

speaker: VIOLA
text: I can say little more than I have studied, and

speaker: VIOLA
text: that question’s out of my part. Good gentle one,

speaker: VIOLA
text: give me modest assurance if you be the lady of the

speaker: VIOLA
text: house, that I may proceed in my speech.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Are you a comedian?

speaker: VIOLA
text: No, my profound heart. And yet by the very

speaker: VIOLA
text: fangs of malice I swear I am not that I play. Are

speaker: VIOLA
text: you the lady of the house?

speaker: OLIVIA
text: If I do not usurp myself, I am.

speaker: VIOLA
text: Most certain, if you are she, you do usurp

speaker: VIOLA
text: yourself, for what is yours to bestow is not yours to

speaker: VIOLA
text: reserve. But this is from my commission. I will on

speaker: VIOLA
text: with my speech in your praise and then show you

speaker: VIOLA
text: the heart of my message.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Come to what is important in ’t. I forgive you

speaker: OLIVIA
text: the praise.

speaker: VIOLA
text: Alas, I took great pains to study it, and ’tis

speaker: VIOLA
text: poetical.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: It is the more like to be feigned. I pray you,

speaker: OLIVIA
text: keep it in. I heard you were saucy at my gates, and

speaker: OLIVIA
text: allowed your approach rather to wonder at you than

speaker: OLIVIA
text: to hear you. If you be not mad, begone; if you have

speaker: OLIVIA
text: reason, be brief. ’Tis not that time of moon with me

speaker: OLIVIA
text: to make one in so skipping a dialogue.

speaker: MARIA
text: Will you hoist sail, sir? Here lies your way.

speaker: VIOLA
text: No, good swabber, I am to hull here a little

speaker: VIOLA
text: longer.—Some mollification for your giant, sweet

speaker: VIOLA
text: lady.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Tell me your mind.

speaker: VIOLA
text: I am a messenger.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Sure you have some hideous matter to deliver

speaker: OLIVIA
text: when the courtesy of it is so fearful. Speak your

speaker: OLIVIA
text: office.

speaker: VIOLA
text: It alone concerns your ear. I bring no overture

speaker: VIOLA
text: of war, no taxation of homage. I hold the olive in

speaker: VIOLA
text: my hand. My words are as full of peace as matter.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Yet you began rudely. What are you? What

speaker: OLIVIA
text: would you?

speaker: VIOLA
text: The rudeness that hath appeared in me have I

speaker: VIOLA
text: learned from my entertainment. What I am and

speaker: VIOLA
text: what I would are as secret as maidenhead: to your

speaker: VIOLA
text: ears, divinity; to any other’s, profanation.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Give us the place alone. We will hear this

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
divinity.
                 
                Maria
                 
                and
                 
                Attendants
                 
                exit
                .
               Now, sir, what

speaker: OLIVIA
text: is your text?

speaker: VIOLA
text: Most sweet lady—

speaker: OLIVIA
text: A comfortable doctrine, and much may be said

speaker: OLIVIA
text: of it. Where lies your text?

speaker: VIOLA
text: In Orsino’s bosom.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: In his bosom? In what chapter of his bosom?

speaker: VIOLA
text: To answer by the method, in the first of his heart.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: O, I have read it; it is heresy. Have you no more

speaker: OLIVIA
text: to say?

speaker: VIOLA
text: Good madam, let me see your face.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: Have you any commission from your lord to

speaker: OLIVIA
text: negotiate with my face? You are now out of your

speaker: OLIVIA
text: text. But we will draw the curtain and show you the

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
picture.
                 
                She
                 
                removes
                 
                her
                 
                veil
                .
               Look you, sir, such a

speaker: OLIVIA
text: one I was this present. Is ’t not well done?

speaker: VIOLA
text: Excellently done, if God did all.

speaker: OLIVIA
text: ’Tis in grain, sir; ’twill endure wind and

speaker: OLIVIA
text: weather.

speaker: VIOLA
text:
’Tis
               
              beauty
               
              truly
               
              blent
              ,
               
              whose
               
              red
               
              and
               
              white

speaker: VIOLA
text:
Nature’s
               
              own
               
              sweet
               
              and
               
              cunning
               
              hand
               
              laid
               
              on
              .

speaker: VIOLA
text:
Lady
              ,
               
              you
               
              are
               
              the
               
              cruel’st
               
              she
               
              alive

speaker: VIOLA
text:
If
               
              you
               
              will
               
              lead
               
              these
               
              graces
               
              to
               
              the
               
              grave

speaker: VIOLA
text:
And
               
              leave
               
              the
               
              world
               
              no
               
              copy
              .

speaker: OLIVIA
text: O, sir, I will not be so hard-hearted! I will give

speaker: OLIVIA
text: out divers schedules of my beauty. It shall be

speaker: OLIVIA
text: inventoried and every particle and utensil labeled

speaker: OLIVIA
text: to my will: as, item, two lips indifferent red; item,

speaker: OLIVIA
text: two gray eyes with lids to them; item, one neck, one

speaker: OLIVIA
text: chin, and so forth. Were you sent hither to praise

speaker: OLIVIA
text: me?

speaker: VIOLA
text:
I
               
              see
               
              you
               
              what
               
              you
               
              are
              .
               
              You
               
              are
               
              too
               
              proud
              .

speaker: VIOLA
text:
But
               
              if
               
              you
               
              were
               
              the
               
              devil
               
              you
               
              are
               
              fair
              .

speaker: VIOLA
text:
My
               
              lord
               
              and
               
              master
               
              loves
               
              you
              .
               
              O
              ,
               
              such
               
              love

speaker: VIOLA
text:
Could
               
              be
               
              but
               
              recompensed
               
              though
               
              you
               
              were
               
              crowned

speaker: VIOLA
text:
The
               
              nonpareil
               
              of
               
              beauty
              .

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
How
               
              does
               
              he
               
              love
               
              me
              ?

speaker: VIOLA
text:
With
               
              adorations
              ,
               
              fertile
               
              tears
              ,

speaker: VIOLA
text:
With
               
              groans
               
              that
               
              thunder
               
              love
              ,
               
              with
               
              sighs
               
              of
               
              fire
              .

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
Your
               
              lord
               
              does
               
              know
               
              my
               
              mind
              .
               
              I
               
              cannot
               
              love
               
              him
              .

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
Yet
               
              I
               
              suppose
               
              him
               
              virtuous
              ,
               
              know
               
              him
               
              noble
              ,

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
Of
               
              great
               
              estate
              ,
               
              of
               
              fresh
               
              and
               
              stainless
               
              youth
              ;

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
In
               
              voices
               
              well
               
              divulged
              ,
               
              free
              ,
               
              learned
              ,
               
              and
               
              valiant
              ,

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
And
               
              in
               
              dimension
               
              and
               
              the
               
              shape
               
              of
               
              nature

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
A
               
              gracious
               
              person
              .
               
              But
               
              yet
               
              I
               
              cannot
               
              love
               
              him
              .

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
He
               
              might
               
              have
               
              took
               
              his
               
              answer
               
              long
               
              ago
              .

speaker: VIOLA
text:
If
               
              I
               
              did
               
              love
               
              you
               
              in
               
              my
               
              master’s
               
              flame
              ,

speaker: VIOLA
text:
With
               
              such
               
              a
               
              suff’ring
              ,
               
              such
               
              a
               
              deadly
               
              life
              ,

speaker: VIOLA
text:
In
               
              your
               
              denial
               
              I
               
              would
               
              find
               
              no
               
              sense
              .

speaker: VIOLA
text:
I
               
              would
               
              not
               
              understand
               
              it
              .

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
Why
              ,
               
              what
               
              would
               
              you
              ?

speaker: VIOLA
text:
Make
               
              me
               
              a
               
              willow
               
              cabin
               
              at
               
              your
               
              gate

speaker: VIOLA
text:
And
               
              call
               
              upon
               
              my
               
              soul
               
              within
               
              the
               
              house
              ,

speaker: VIOLA
text:
Write
               
              loyal
               
              cantons
               
              of
               
              contemnèd
               
              love

speaker: VIOLA
text:
And
               
              sing
               
              them
               
              loud
               
              even
               
              in
               
              the
               
              dead
               
              of
               
              night
              ,

speaker: VIOLA
text:
Hallow
               
              your
               
              name
               
              to
               
              the
               
              reverberate
               
              hills

speaker: VIOLA
text:
And
               
              make
               
              the
               
              babbling
               
              gossip
               
              of
               
              the
               
              air

speaker: VIOLA
text:
Cry
               
              out
               
              “
              Olivia
              !
              ”
               
              O
              ,
               
              you
               
              should
               
              not
               
              rest

speaker: VIOLA
text:
Between
               
              the
               
              elements
               
              of
               
              air
               
              and
               
              earth

speaker: VIOLA
text:
But
               
              you
               
              should
               
              pity
               
              me
              .

text:
You
               
              might
               
              do
               
              much
              .

speaker: OLIVIA
text:
What
               
              is
               
              your
               
              parentage
              ?

speaker: VIOLA
text:
Above
               
              my
               
              fortunes
              ,
               
              yet
               
              my
               
              state
               
              is
               
              well
              .

speaker: VIOLA
text:
I
               
              am
               
              a

              .

text:
Get
               
              you
               
              to
               
              your

              .

speaker: OLIVIA

I

Unless

To
